content: Securities Dividends ETF Investments Asked by Shabir KhanAsked on 21 Mar 2019Are there any ETFs' in Singapore that re-invest dividends rather than paying them out?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Nicholes Wong, Diploma in Business Management at Nanyang PolytechnicLevel 6. MasterUpdated on 22 Mar 2019As far as i know, there is none. You have to reinvest the dividends yourself. Singapore ETFs are not that good as well. I think you should take a look at ireland domiciled etf on london stock exchange. They reduce the US withholding tax from 30% to 15%, have more and better ETFs for you to choose and there are ETFs that re-invest dividends which they call Accumulating ETFs if that is what you are interested in.0 comments1
